intro: Eutoca viscida, commonly known as the sticky eutoca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that produce a sticky substance. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Eutoca viscida is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
